snippet: As negotiators from both sides resumed talks in a border village on Sunday afternoon, Pyongyang was deploying more artillery toward the border, the South said.
abstract: North Korea, in apparent ratcheting up of forces, has been deploying more artillery along Korean border and sending out many of its submarines as it conducts high-level talks with South Korea over military standoff; representatives from both sides so far have failed to negotiate terms in which South Korea would stop broadcasting propaganda on loudspeakers at the border.
lead_paragraph: As negotiators from both sides resumed talks in a border village on Sunday afternoon, Pyongyang was deploying more artillery toward the border, the South said.

headline.main: North Korea Moves Forces Amid Talks With South
headline.print_headline: North Korea Moves Forces Amid Talks With South
